title: Oscillatory Regimes in a Game-Theoretic Model for Mosquito Population Dynamics under Breeding Site Control
summary: This paper introduces a game-theoretic model to investigate how spontaneous household decision-making regarding breeding site control influences mosquito population dynamics. It reveals that the feedback loop between perceived risks, household control actions, and mosquito abundance can lead to sustained oscillations in mosquito populations, independent of environmental factors. The study characterizes conditions under which these human-behaviorally driven oscillations emerge.

title: FlowLet: Conditional 3D Brain MRI Synthesis using Wavelet Flow Matching
summary: FlowLet addresses the scarcity and demographic imbalance of 3D brain MRI datasets crucial for Brain Age Prediction (BAP) by proposing a novel conditional generative framework. It synthesizes age-conditioned 3D MRIs efficiently using flow matching within an invertible 3D wavelet domain, thereby avoiding latent compression artifacts and reducing computational demands. This approach generates high-fidelity volumes, significantly improving BAP performance for underrepresented age groups while preserving anatomical accuracy.

title: An interpretable data-driven approach to optimizing clinical fall risk assessment
summary: This study developed and validated an interpretable data-driven approach, using Constrained Score Optimization (CSO), to recalibrate the Johns Hopkins Fall Risk Assessment Tool (JHFRAT). The CSO model significantly improved fall risk prediction (AUC-ROC=0.91 vs. 0.86 for original JHFRAT) over a retrospective cohort of 54,209 inpatient admissions, translating to protecting an additional 35 high-risk patients weekly.

title: ROOFS: RObust biOmarker Feature Selection
summary: ROOFS is a Python package designed to assist researchers in selecting optimal feature selection (FS) methods for biomarker discovery in complex biomedical datasets. It benchmarks various FS approaches using comprehensive metrics like predictive performance (with optimism correction), stability, and reliability. Applied to a lung cancer immunotherapy resistance dataset, ROOFS identified a specific p-value based filter as superior, demonstrating its capacity to enhance the robustness and translational value of clinical predictive models.

title: Atlas 2 -- Foundation models for clinical deployment
summary: This paper introduces Atlas 2, Atlas 2-B, and Atlas 2-S, a new family of pathology vision foundation models designed to overcome existing tradeoffs in performance, robustness, and computational requirements that previously limited clinical deployment. Trained on the largest pathology foundation model dataset to date (5.5 million histopathology whole slide images), these models achieved state-of-the-art performance across eighty public benchmarks, paving the way for practical clinical integration.

title: A Lightweight and Explainable Vision-Language Framework for Crop Disease Visual Question Answering
summary: This paper introduces a lightweight and explainable vision-language framework designed for visual question answering (VQA) concerning crop disease identification from leaf images. The framework combines a Swin Transformer vision encoder with sequence-to-sequence language decoders, achieving high accuracy in crop and disease identification and strong natural language generation metrics. It outperforms larger baseline models with significantly fewer parameters, highlighting the effectiveness of task-specific pretraining.

title: TokenSeg: Efficient 3D Medical Image Segmentation via Hierarchical Visual Token Compression
summary: TokenSeg introduces a novel boundary-aware sparse token representation framework designed for efficient and accurate 3D medical image segmentation. It achieves state-of-the-art performance on diverse MRI datasets (breast, cardiac, brain) while substantially reducing computational demands in terms of GPU memory and inference latency. This highlights the effectiveness of anatomically informed sparse representations for practical clinical applications.

title: A Semi-supervised Molecular Learning Framework for Activity Cliff Estimation
summary: This paper introduces SemiMol, a novel semi-supervised learning (SSL) framework designed to improve molecular property prediction, particularly for challenging activity cliffs and low-data scenarios critical in drug discovery. SemiMol integrates pseudo-labeling with an 'instructor model' to evaluate label trustworthiness in regression tasks and employs a self-adaptive curriculum learning algorithm, demonstrating significant performance enhancements for graph-based ML architectures and outperforming state-of-the-art baselines.

title: A Generalized Adaptive Joint Learning Framework for High-Dimensional Time-Varying Models
summary: This paper introduces Adaptive Joint Learning (AJL), a novel regularization framework designed to address the limitations of standard functional data analysis in capturing abrupt structural shifts and complex time-varying associations within high-dimensional longitudinal biomedical data. AJL simultaneously performs functional variable selection and structural changepoint detection in multivariate time-varying coefficient models. The method offers strong theoretical guarantees, including the oracle property in ultra-high-dimensional settings, and effectively identifies synchronized disease progression phases and prognostic markers in Primary Biliary Cirrhosis (PBC) data.
